title: Remote Simulation-Based Educational Design for Biological Molecular Experiments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of general chemistry and fundamental understanding of biological molecules
context.additional_context: Remote chemistry lab education for pre-service/in-service teachers, emphasizing situation-based learning linked to real-world issues like COVID-19.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the structure-function relationship of biological molecules through VR simulation and quantitatively explain experimental results.
Learners can identify at least two or more experimental design errors and propose corrections based on real-time feedback from peers in a collaborative learning environment.
Learners can systematically document the scientific inquiry process for solving social issues through chemistry experiments related to COVID-19.

resources: Online collaboration tools (Miro, Google Jamboard, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
